Package de.tum.cit.fop.maze

Class VoiceManager

java.lang.Object
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.VoiceManager
public final class VoiceManager extends Object
The class VoiceManager acts as an audio manager for all vocal sound effects in the game. some of the features include category-based volume control, and global mute functionality.

  • Constructor Details

    • VoiceManager

      public VoiceManager()

  • Method Details

    • init

      public static void init()
      Initializes the VoiceManager and loads all sound files. Must be called ONCE at game startup (typically in MazeRunnerGame.create()).

    • play

      public static void play(String key, VoiceManager.Category category, float pitchMin, float pitchMax, float volume)
      Core sound playing method with full control over all parameters. All convenience methods (playPlayer, playUI, etc.) delegate to this.
      Parameters:
      key - sound identifier (must be loaded via init())
      category - which category this sound belongs to
      pitchMin - minimum pitch multiplier (0.5 = half speed, 2.0 = double speed)
      pitchMax - maximum pitch multiplier
      volume - base volume (0.0 to 1.0, before category multiplier)

    • playPlayer

      public static void playPlayer(String key)
      Plays a player-related sound with subtle pitch variation. Used for: attacks, hurt sounds, footsteps, dash, sprint.

      Pitch range: 0.95 to 1.05 (Â±5%) Category: PLAYER (100% volume by default)

      Parameters:
      key - sound identifier (e.g., "player_attack_1")

    • playEnemy

      public static void playEnemy(String key)
      Plays an enemy-related sound with moderate pitch variation. Used for: enemy deaths, hits, special attacks.

      Pitch range: 0.9 to 1.1 (Â±10%) Category: ENEMY (100% volume by default)

      Parameters:
      key - sound identifier (e.g., "enemy_normal_die")

    • playUI

      public static void playUI(String key)
      Plays a UI sound with no pitch variation (consistency). Used for: button clicks, toggles, navigation, errors.

      Pitch range: 1.0 to 1.0 (no variation) Category: UI (80% volume by default, slightly quieter)

      Parameters:
      key - sound identifier (e.g., "ui_click")

    • playAnnouncer

      public static void playAnnouncer(String key)
      Plays an announcer sound with no pitch variation (clarity). Used for: achievements, game over, victory.

      Pitch range: 1.0 to 1.0 (no variation) Category: ANNOUNCER (100% volume, important events)

      Parameters:
      key - sound identifier (e.g., "achievement_unlocked")

    • playCollect

      public static void playCollect(String key)
      Plays a collectible pickup sound with slight pitch variation. Used for: hearts, keys, powerups, weapons, coins.

      Pitch range: 0.95 to 1.05 (Â±5%) Category: UI (80% volume, treated as UI feedback) Volume: 0.9 (slightly quieter than UI buttons)

      Parameters:
      key - sound identifier (e.g., "collect_heart")

    • playTrap

      public static void playTrap(String key)
      Plays a trap/hazard activation sound with moderate pitch variation. Used for: spike traps, slowness traps, root traps.

      Pitch range: 0.9 to 1.1 (Â±10%) Category: ENEMY (treated as environmental hazard) Volume: 0.8 (quieter than direct enemy sounds)

      Parameters:
      key - sound identifier (e.g., "trap_spike")

    • playLevel

      public static void playLevel(String key)
      Plays a level event sound with no pitch variation (consistency). Used for: level start, level complete, door opening.

      Pitch range: 1.0 to 1.0 (no variation) Category: ANNOUNCER (important progression events) Volume: 0.9 (slightly quieter than victory/game over)

      Parameters:
      key - sound identifier (e.g., "level_start")

    • playRandom

      public static void playRandom(VoiceManager.Category category, String... keys)
      Plays a random sound from a list of variants. Increases audio variety by randomly selecting from multiple similar sounds.

      Parameters:
      category - which category these sounds belong to
      keys - array of sound identifiers to choose from

    • setCategoryVolume

      public static void setCategoryVolume(VoiceManager.Category category, float volume)
      Sets the volume multiplier for an entire category. Affects all sounds in that category globally.
      Parameters:
      category - which category to adjust
      volume - new volume multiplier (0.0 to 1.0)

    • dispose

      public static void dispose()
      Cleans up all loaded sound resources. Must be called in MazeRunnerGame.dispose() to prevent memory leaks.

      After calling dispose(), init() must be called again before using sounds.

    • setVolume

      public static void setVolume(float vol)

    • getVolume

      public static float getVolume()
